CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 1, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "NAACP MEMBERSHIP DRIVE OPENS - The 1954 membership campaign of the Pittsburgh Branch of the NAACP opened Sunday at a meeting at Wesley Center AME Zion Church. At the right: the Rev. Charles H. Foggie, minister of the Wesley Center Church, introduces his wife to the principal speaker, Councilman Theodore M. Berry, of Cincinnati ... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Rev. Charles H. Foggie, Madeline Sharpe Foggie, and Theodore M. Berry shaking her hand, during NAACP membership drive in Wesley Center AME Zion Church
